column4: what is the difference between "sudo apt-get upgrade" and "sudo apt-get dist upgrade?
dist-upgrade will install new version of packages (or new packages), while upgrade will not
ok, which one of them shoud i use to update my system?
honestly the "safest" would be to install aptitude and use the command "sudo aptitude safe-upgrade", BUT dist-upgrade is the same as the GUI update manager does.
